detailed_translations.english: to officially examine a company’s financial records in order to check that they are correct
an official examination of a company’s financial records in order to check that they are correct

sentences.english: Sorry to disturb you, but I have an urgent message.
sentences.chinese: 对不起打扰一下，我有个紧急消息。

sentences.english: The thieves fled when they were disturbed by a neighbour.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼们被一名邻居惊动后逃跑了。

sentences.english: (= a sign you put on a door so that people will not interrupt you ) .
sentences.chinese: 请勿打扰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 打扰；妨碍；使不安；弄乱；使恼怒
detailed_translations.english: to interrupt someone so that they cannot continue what they are doing

sentences.english: He offered to do the job for a few coppers.
sentences.chinese: 他说他来做这份工作，给他几个铜板就行。

sentences.english: His hair has reverted back to its original copper hue.
sentences.chinese: 他的头发恢复到了原来的铜色。

detailed_translations.english: a soft reddish-brown metal that allows electricity and heat to pass through it easily, and is used to make electrical wires, water pipes etc. It is a chemical element: symbol Cu
Copper is sometimes used to describe things that are reddish-brown in colour

sentences.english: There were insuperable obstacles, and the plan was abandoned.
sentences.chinese: 由于存在无法克服的障碍，计划被放弃了。

sentences.english: As usual, the hero was facing insuperable odds.
sentences.chinese: 照例，男主角遇到了无法克服的困难。

detailed_translations.english: an insuperable difficulty or problem is impossible to deal with

sentences.english: If the pain persists, you must see a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 如果一直痛，你就必须去看医生了。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad persists, it continues to exist or happen

sentences.english: Your intake of alcohol should not exceed two units per day.
sentences.chinese: 你每天酒精摄入量不能超过两个单位。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of food, drink etc that you take into your body

sentences.english: I made the then heretical suggestion that it might be cheaper to design new machines.
sentences.chinese: 我提出了当时被当做旁门左道的建议，说设计新机器或许更省钱。

detailed_translations.english: A belief or action that is heretical is one that most people think is wrong because it disagrees with beliefs that are generally accepted

name: calendar
trans: 日历； 历法； 日程表

sentences.english: There was a calendar on the wall above, with large squares around the dates.
sentences.chinese: 墙的上方曾有一本日历，日期框在大方格里。

sentences.english: The Christian calendar was originally based on the Julian calendar of the Romans.
sentences.chinese: 公历最初是基于罗马的儒略历的。

detailed_translations.english: a set of pages that show the days, weeks, and months of a particular year, that you usually hang on a wall

sentences.english: Is there a shortfall or oversupply?
sentences.chinese: 是否有供应不足或者供给过多？

sentences.english: OPEC's members have been trying to limit production to ease oversupply.
sentences.chinese: 欧佩克成员国一直试图限制产量以缓解供应过剩。

sentences.english: Worse, the extreme growth of investment during the financial crisis has added to the problem of oversupply.
sentences.chinese: 更糟的是，在金融危机期间，极端的投资增长进一步加剧了供过于求的问题。

detailed_translations.english: to supply too much (material, etc) or too many (goods, people, etc)
the state of having more of something than you need or can sell

name: orator
trans: 演说者； 演讲者； 雄辩家

sentences.english: He was a natural politician, a gifted orator who knew how to work a crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是位天生的政治家，是位有天赋且知道如何凝集民众的演说家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 演说者；演讲者；雄辩家；原告
detailed_translations.english: someone who is good at making speeches and persuading people

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

name: launch
trans: 发起； 推出； 发射

sentences.english: A test satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral.
sentences.chinese: 一颗实验人造卫星从卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

sentences.english: The organization has launched a campaign to raise $150,000.
sentences.chinese: 为了筹集15万美元，该组织发起了一场募捐活动。

sentences.english: The Canadian police plan to launch an investigation into the deal.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大警方计划对这宗交易进行调查。

sentences.english: The book launched his career as a novelist.
sentences.chinese: 这本书开启了他的小说创作生涯。

detailed_translations.english: to send a weapon or spacecraft into the sky or into space

name: sanitary
trans: 卫生的； 公共卫生的

sentences.english: Diseases were spread through poor sanitary conditions .
sentences.chinese: 疾病因卫生条件很差而传播开来。

sentences.english: a prison with no proper sanitary facilities
sentences.chinese: 一座缺少适当卫生设施的监狱

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ways that dirt, infection, and waste are removed, so that places are clean and healthy for people to live in

sentences.english: The government was taking little heed of these threats.
sentences.chinese: 政府对这些威胁几乎不当回事。

sentences.english: Tom paid no heed to her warning.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆根本没有理会她的警告。

detailed_translations.english: to pay attention to something, especially something someone says, and seriously consider it
to pay attention to someone’s advice or warning

name: dismantle
trans: 拆除； 废除， 取消

sentences.english: He asked for immediate help from the United States to dismantle the warheads.
sentences.chinese: 他向美国请求即时援助，拆除弹头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拆除；取消；解散；除掉…的覆盖物
detailed_translations.english: If you dismantle a machine or structure, you carefully separate it into its different parts

name: boomerang
trans: 回飞棒； 自食其果的言行

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞去来器；自食其果的行为；回飞棒
detailed_translations.english: a curved stick that flies in a circle and comes back to you when you throw it, first used in Australia

sentences.english: The gyroscope in tank is used to stabilize the aim system of the gun.
sentences.chinese: 坦克中的陀螺仪用于稳定火炮的瞄准系统。

sentences.english: Used in combination with GPS, an accelerometer, a compass and the gyroscope can be used for in indoor navigation with floor accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 与全球定位系统、加速度计、陀螺仪和指南针结合使用，可用于具有地面精度的室内导航。

sentences.english: Discovery is delivering a new astronaut sleeping quarters, an ammonia tank and a gyroscope for the space station.
sentences.chinese: “发现”号将为空间站送去一个新的宇航员睡觉舱，一个氨水箱和一个回转仪。

detailed_translations.english: a wheel that spins inside a frame and is used for keeping ships and aircraft steady. It can also be a child’s toy.

name: unequalled
trans: 无与伦比的； 不等同的

sentences.english: The hotel has a range of facilities unequalled in the city.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店拥有本市最好的各种设施。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无与伦比的；不等同的，不能比拟的
detailed_translations.english: better than any other

name: confirm
trans: 证实， 使有效； 确定

sentences.english: New evidence has confirmed the first witness’s story.
sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.english: To confirm my diagnosis I need to do some tests.
sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

detailed_translations.english: to state or show that sth is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence

sentences.english: The return of the disequilibrated organ systems of the body to steady states or dynamic stability is known as homeostasis.
sentences.chinese: 人们身体里失调的器官系统恢复到稳定的或动态稳定状态的过程被称为体内平衡。

sentences.english: In order to maintain this homeostasis, the brain deploys motivations such as pain, hunger, thirst and fear, as well the complementary pleasures of food, water, sex and safety.
sentences.chinese: 为了保持这种体内平衡，大脑对我们会施加如疼痛、饥渴和恐惧等刺激，同样也会在得到食物、水、性满足和安全感时发出喜悦的信号。

detailed_translations.chinese: [生理] 体内平衡；[自] 内稳态

sentences.english: Mortality from heart disease varies widely across the world.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病死亡率世界各地差异很大。

detailed_translations.english: the number of deaths during a particular period of time among a particular type or group of people

sentences.english: officials appointed by the government
sentences.chinese: 政府任命的官员

sentences.english: The committee appointed a day in June for celebrations.
sentences.chinese: 委员会把庆典定在6月的一天举行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 任命，委派；约定，确定，指定
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for a position or a job

name: assist
trans: 参加， 出席； 帮助， 促进

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

detailed_translations.english: to help someone to do something
If you assist someone, you help them to do a job or task by doing part of the work for them

sentences.english: Mash the bananas to a pulp .
sentences.chinese: 把香蕉捣成糊状。

sentences.english: timber grown for wood pulp
sentences.chinese: 种植以制造纸浆的树木

sentences.english: a soft pulp of leaves and mud
sentences.chinese: 树叶和泥巴混成的浆液

detailed_translations.english: a very soft substance that is almost liquid, made by crushing plants, wood, vegetables etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…化成纸浆；除去…的果肉
detailed_translations.english: to beat or crush something until it becomes very soft and almost liquid

sentences.english: Next month, biologists should know how many females are pregnant and how many crossbred babies will be born this year.
sentences.chinese: 下个月，生物学家就将得知，该计划中有多少雌性侏儒兔已经怀孕以及今年将诞生多少杂交的兔宝宝。

sentences.english: At some point, early colonists crossbred smaller European-bred stock with American wild turkeys to produce hearty but tame breeds such as the Standard Bronze.
sentences.chinese: 从某个时候开始，早期的殖民者将欧洲饲养的体型较小的火鸡与美国野火鸡杂交，从而培育出了标准青铜色火鸡这样健硕而温驯的火鸡品种。

sentences.english: Grass of crossbred color page is vivacious herb, its alias has multicoloured revive, foreign purple perilla.
sentences.chinese: 杂种彩叶草为多年生草本植物，其别名有五彩苏、洋紫苏等。

detailed_translations.english: (of plants or animals) produced as a result of crossbreeding
a crossbred plant or animal, esp an animal resulting from a cross between two pure breeds

detailed_translations.chinese: 杂交繁育（crossbreed的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: "If you can stop the enzymes involved in that process with a small molecule or chemical," says Dunman, "that chemical could be an antibiotic.
sentences.chinese: “如果能用一小分子或化学物质阻止这一酶的活性过程，”德明说，“这种化学物质就能够用来做抗生素。”

sentences.english: If we all recognize that antibiotic resistance is one of the greatest threats to public health that we face today, we have to do something about this.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们大家都能认识到耐抗生素（药性）已经成为我们今天面对的最大的公众健康威胁之一，我们就真的需要做点什么了。

detailed_translations.english: a drug that is used to kill  bacteria  and cure infections

sentences.english: There are some dissenting voices (= people who do not agree ) among the undergraduates.
sentences.chinese: 大学生中有一些反对的呼声。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you disagree with an official decision or accepted opinion
refusal to agree with an official decision or accepted opinion

sentences.english: The bombs ignited a fire which destroyed some 60 houses.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹引起了一场火灾，烧毁了大约六十间房屋。

detailed_translations.english: When you ignite something or when it ignites, it starts burning or explodes
to start burning, or to make something start burning

sentences.english: Our top priorities must be profit and commercial growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须把利润和贸易增长作为我们的第一要务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 商业的， 商务的； 商品化的， 商业性的
detailed_translations.english: related to business and the buying and selling of goods and services

name: separate
trans: 分开的； 单个的； 不同的

sentences.english: The gym and the sauna are in separate buildings.
sentences.chinese: 健身房和桑拿浴室在不同的大楼里。

detailed_translations.english: not joined to or touching something else

sentences.english: saline solution
sentences.chinese: 盐溶液

detailed_translations.english: containing or consisting of salt

sentences.english: The doctor took a urine sample and a blood sample.
sentences.chinese: 医生取了尿样和血样。

detailed_translations.english: the yellow liquid waste that comes out of the body from the bladder

sentences.english: ...the calamitous state of the country.
sentences.chinese: ...该国家的悲惨境况。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe an event or situation as calamitous, you mean it is very unfortunate or serious

sentences.english: Grilled trout needs only a squeeze of lemon.
sentences.chinese: 烤鳟鱼只需要一点柠檬榨汁。

detailed_translations.english: a common river-fish, often used for food, or the flesh of this fish

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

sentences.english: We confined our study to ten cases.
sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.english: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks (= made to stay in the barracks ) .
sentences.chinese: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

sentences.english: within the confines of the prison
sentences.chinese: 在监狱范围内

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
limits or borders

sentences.english: He had been questing for religious belief from an early age.
sentences.chinese: 他从早年开始就一直在寻求宗教信仰。

sentences.english: ...his questing mind and boundless enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: …他的探索型头脑和无限的热情

detailed_translations.english: to search for sth that is difficult to find

sentences.english: Businesses come and go with alarming frequency.
sentences.chinese: 商家开张停业惊人地频繁。

sentences.english: the frequency of serious road accidents
sentences.chinese: 重大道路交通事故的发生率

detailed_translations.english: the fact that something happens a lot

sentences.english: My letters to her have elicited no response.
sentences.chinese: 我写给她的信没有得到回应。

detailed_translations.english: If you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions

sentences.english: legal ambiguities
sentences.chinese: 法律上含混不清的地方

detailed_translations.chinese: 含糊；不明确；暧昧；模棱两可的话
detailed_translations.english: the state of being unclear, confusing, or not certain, or things that produce this effect

name: trivial
trans: 琐屑的， 微不足道的

sentences.english: a trivial detail
sentences.chinese: 细枝末节

sentences.english: I know it sounds trivial , but I'm worried about it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这事听起来微不足道，但我还是放心不下。

detailed_translations.english: not important or serious; not worth considering

sentences.english: ...a sniper attack.
sentences.chinese: …一次狙击手的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: someone who shoots at people from a hidden position

sentences.english: The others barely glanced at it and went back to their shovels, almost enthusiastically, searching for the French Woman, but I went up to the body and forced myself to look at it closely.
sentences.chinese: 其他的人几乎连看都没看上一眼，就拿起他们的锹，差不多都很热心地去寻找那个法国女人的尸体，但我凑到那具尸体前，迫使我自己仔细地看看。

sentences.english: a nuclear missile
sentences.chinese: 核导弹

sentences.english: a missile attack
sentences.chinese: 导弹袭击

detailed_translations.english: a weapon that can fly over long distances and that explodes when it hits the thing it has been aimed at

detailed_translations.chinese: 导弹的；可投掷的；用以发射导弹的

sentences.english: The ancient Chinese claimed that garlic promoted longevity.
sentences.chinese: 中国古人说蒜能延寿。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of time that someone or something lives

sentences.english: a dynamic and unstable process
sentences.chinese: 不断变化的、不稳定的过程

detailed_translations.chinese: 有活力的；动力的；不断变化的
detailed_translations.english: continuously moving or changing
something that causes action or change

sentences.english: She gave a reluctant smile.
sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

detailed_translations.english: slow and unwilling

name: generate
trans: 生成， 产生； 引起

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.english: The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or cause something

sentences.english: Extreme poverty still exists in many rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 许多农村地区仍处于赤贫状态。

sentences.english: extreme cold
sentences.chinese: 严寒

sentences.english: He had extreme difficulty getting hold of the ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

detailed_translations.english: very great in degree
a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

sentences.english: As chemical precursors stream onto the surface of a rolling metal or plastic substrate, they react with one another to form a network of nanoparticles.
sentences.chinese: 各化学母质流向滚动中的金属或塑料基片的表面，他们互相作用，形成一层纳米级微粒网状结构。

sentences.english: Fundamentally, these paradigms can be (and are) built on top of a substrate of threads and locks, but they create higher level abstractions that push much of that complexity down.
sentences.chinese: 从根本上讲，这些范例可以（且是）构建于线程和锁的基底之上，但是它们创建降低复杂度的更高的抽象级别。

sentences.english: This means that a file system would serve as a reasonable substrate for a synchronization database.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着文件系统作为同步数据库的底层支持是合情合理的。

detailed_translations.english: the substance upon which an enzyme acts

sentences.english: His findings are based on anecdotal evidence rather than serious research.
sentences.chinese: 他的发现依据的是传闻轶事，而不是认真的调查研究。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轶事的；轶事一样的；多轶事的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of short stories based on someone’s personal experience

sentences.english: You could say that nail polish is preservative free!
sentences.chinese: 你可以说指甲油是一种免费的防腐剂。

sentences.english: It is the most widely-used preservative for vaccines.
sentences.chinese: 它是一种最为使用广泛的疫苗防腐剂。

sentences.english: It is used as a preservative in certain acid food products.
sentences.chinese: 在某些酸性食物制品中它被使用作为防腐剂。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that is used to prevent things from decaying, for example food or wood

sentences.english: The maoist state preached egalitarianism and relied on the loyalty of workers and peasants.
sentences.chinese: 毛的国家主张平等主义和依靠工人农民的忠诚。

sentences.english: A tourist encounters a whole new machinery for the attainment of egalitarianism: the beheading of state officials at the end of their respective terms.
sentences.chinese: 一个旅行者遇到了一架为了达到平等主义而造出来的全新的机器：它用来在任期结束的时候砍去国家官员的头。

sentences.english: They might benefit, for instance, from knowing about work suggesting that "a certain level of egalitarianism" in relationships seems to be healthy.
sentences.chinese: 比如，有研究表明，在关系中“一定程度的平等主义”似乎是健康的，了解这样的研究就可能会令关系受益。

detailed_translations.english: Egalitarianism is used to refer to the belief that all people are equal and should have the same rights and opportunities, and to actions that are based on this belief

sentences.english: Matching bag and accessories provide a complete ensemble of colour coordinates.
sentences.chinese: 颜色协调的包和饰品使全套服装的颜色搭配齐全了。

detailed_translations.english: one of a set of numbers which give the exact position of a point on a map, computer screen etc
equal in importance or rank in a sentence
to organize an activity so that the people involved in it work well together and achieve a good result

name: authoritative
trans: 权威的， 官方的； 专断的

sentences.english: the most authoritative work on English surnames
sentences.chinese: 有关英语姓氏的最权威著作

detailed_translations.english: an authoritative book, account etc is respected because the person who wrote it knows a lot about the subject

sentences.english: The purchaser is the primary actor.
sentences.chinese: 购买者是主要的参与者。

sentences.english: The purchaser must ultimately ensure that there is a high-quality computer component.
sentences.chinese: 购买者最终一定要确保计算机里面是高质量的部件。

sentences.english: Over 500 people died during last year’s flu epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 去年流感大暴发期间有五百多人死亡。

detailed_translations.english: a large number of cases of a disease that happen at the same time

sentences.english: ...the John A. Sibley Horticultural Centre.
sentences.chinese: …约翰A.西布莉园艺中心。

detailed_translations.english: Horticultural means concerned with horticulture

name: retarded
trans: 智力迟钝的； 发展迟缓的

sentences.english: ...a special school for mentally retarded children.
sentences.chinese: …一家弱智儿童的特殊学校

sentences.english: Despite yesterday’s win, there is clearly no room for complacency if the team want to stay top of the league.
sentences.chinese: 尽管这支球队昨天赢了，但要在联赛中独占鳌头，就不能骄傲自满。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of satisfaction with a situation or with what you have achieved, so that you stop trying to improve or change things – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: Scans of his chest, abdomen, and pelvis likewise showed nothing.
sentences.chinese: 扫描他的胸部，腹部和骨盆也没有什么发现。

sentences.english: However, if you have pain in only one of your hips, you probably have either an uneven pelvis or unequal leg lengths.
sentences.chinese: 然而，如果你只是一侧髋关节疼痛，那么你可能骨盆不平衡或者腿长度不一致。

sentences.english: Though Ardi would have spent much of her time in the trees, her pelvis was adapted to walking upright when she came down to the forest floor.
sentences.chinese: 尽管阿迪一生中大部分时间也许是在树上渡过的，但当她下到森林地面上时，她的骨盆是适合直立行走的。

detailed_translations.english: the set of large wide curved bones at the base of your  spine  , to which your legs are joined

sentences.english: Your body full compliance with the requirements of conscription.
sentences.chinese: 你的身体完全符合征兵要求。

sentences.english: They were rather earnest about the Tommies, and the threat of conscription, and the shortage of sugar and toffee for the children.
sentences.chinese: 他们对于军队，对于征兵的恐吓，对于儿童们的糖与糖果的缺乏，是颇郑重其事的。

sentences.english: Other sources of extra-budgetary income include funds from the central government and local governments for defense mobilization preparations, conscription, and demobilization.
sentences.chinese: 其他预算外进项来源包括来自中央和地方用于防卫动员的准备工作、征兵以及复员安排的资金。

detailed_translations.english: when people are made to join the army, navy etc

sentences.english: The light creates the aurora that we see.
sentences.chinese: 这些光亮造就了我们所看到的极光。

sentences.english: A vast dawn of ideas is the peculiarity of our century, and in that aurora England and Germany have a magnificent radiance.
sentences.chinese: 思想的广泛昌明是我们这一世纪的特征，在那曙光里，英国和德国都有它们辉煌的成就。

detailed_translations.english: an atmospheric phenomenon consisting of bands, curtains, or streamers of light, usually green, red, or yellow, that move across the sky in polar regions

sentences.english: a distribution centre
sentences.chinese: 经销中心

detailed_translations.english: the act of sharing things among a large group of people in a planned way

sentences.english: a sedentary people living north of the Danube
sentences.chinese: 多瑙河北面的一个定居民族

detailed_translations.chinese: 久坐的；坐惯的；定栖的；静坐的
detailed_translations.english: spending a lot of time sitting down, and not moving or exercising very much

name: derive
trans: 得到， 得自； 推论出

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

sentences.english: Dr. Geoghagan says the cost can be much higher after factoring in materials to help prepare, other expenses and unreimbursed time.
sentences.chinese: 乔根甘博士说，计入准备考试的材料费、其他花费以及无法补偿的时间，考试的成本还要高得多。

name: capacity
trans: 最大容量； 最大生产量； 能力

sentences.english: The room had seating capacity for about 80.
sentences.chinese: 这房间能坐80个人左右。

sentences.english: The orchestra played to a capacity crowd (= the largest number of people who can fit into a hall, theatre etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 管弦乐队为满场的观众演奏。

sentences.english: All the hotels were filled to capacity.
sentences.chinese: 所有的宾馆都住满了。

sentences.english: a child’s capacity for learning
sentences.chinese: 孩子的学习能力

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space a container, room etc has to hold things or people

name: inescapable
trans: 不可避免的； 逃脱不了的

sentences.english: She didn’t want to confront the inescapable fact that she would have to sell the house.
sentences.chinese: 她不想面对必须卖掉房子这一无法逃避的事实。

sentences.english: The inescapable conclusion is that he was murdered by someone in his own family.
sentences.chinese: 必然的结论就是: 他是被自己的家人谋杀的。

detailed_translations.english: an inescapable fact or situation is one that you cannot avoid or ignore
if you are undeterred by something, you do not allow it to stop you doing what you want

sentences.english: Occasionally people confess to crimes they haven’t committed just to get attention.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔人们会承认自己并未犯过的罪行，那只是为了引人注意。

sentences.english: Torture was used and Fian confessed.
sentences.chinese: 酷刑用过之后菲安就招供了。

detailed_translations.english: to admit, especially to the police, that you have done something wrong or illegal

sentences.english: They admitted counterfeiting documents.
sentences.chinese: 他们承认伪造了文件。

sentences.english: Levi Strauss says counterfeits of the company's jeans are flooding Europe.
sentences.chinese: 利瓦伊·斯特劳斯说该公司牛仔裤的仿冒品充斥着欧洲市场。

detailed_translations.english: to copy something exactly in order to deceive people
Counterfeit is also a noun
made to look exactly like something else, in order to deceive people

sentences.english: The bed can be folded flat for storage.
sentences.chinese: 这张床可以折扁存放。

sentences.english: He lay flat on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他平躺在地板上。

sentences.english: That night I lay flat on my back and stared up at the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 那一夜，我仰面平躺，眼睛直直地盯着天花板。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平直地； 直截了当地
detailed_translations.english: in a position in which the surface of something is against another surface without curving or sloping

detailed_translations.chinese: 平的；固定的；漏气的；单调的，沉闷的；浅的
detailed_translations.english: smooth and level, without raised or hollow areas, and not sloping or curving
a place for people to live that consists of a set of rooms that are part of a larger building

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

sentences.english: You don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你不会恰巧还想得起他的名字吧？

sentences.english: As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 我记得，是你首先提出这个想法的。

sentences.english: Cole was recalled to the squad to replace the injured Quinn.
sentences.chinese: 科尔被召回队里代替受伤的奎因。

sentences.english: The cars had to be recalled due to an engine fault.
sentences.chinese: 由于发动机缺陷，那些汽车必须召回。

detailed_translations.english: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past
a woman who is a former student of a school, college etc

sentences.english: a 50% increase in the number of traffic fatalities
sentences.chinese: 交通事故死亡人数50%的增长

detailed_translations.chinese: 死亡；宿命；致命性；不幸；灾祸
detailed_translations.english: a death in an accident or a violent attack

name: precise
trans: 准确的， 精确的； 严谨的

sentences.english: precise sales figures
sentences.chinese: 准确的销售数据

sentences.english: It was difficult to get precise information.
sentences.chinese: 很难得到确切的消息。

sentences.english: ‘She’s a lot older than you, isn’t she?’ ‘Fifteen years, to be precise .’
sentences.chinese: “她比你大很多，是不是？”“准确地说，大了15岁。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 精确的， 准确的； 严谨的
detailed_translations.english: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

name: sprinkler
trans: 洒水装置； 消防喷嘴

sentences.english: Run through the sprinkler together.
sentences.chinese: 一起跑过洒水车.

sentences.english: You start by helping the child feel more secure around water by just having fun on a slip and slide with the sprinkler.
sentences.chinese: 起先，你要通过利用洒水器，让孩子从中感受到滑上滑下的快乐，使他觉得在水的周围更加安全。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for scattering water on grass or soil

sentences.english: a brief interlude of peace before a return to the battlefield
sentences.chinese: 重返战场之前的短暂平静

detailed_translations.chinese: 插曲；穿插；幕间节目；[数] 插算
detailed_translations.english: a period of time between two events or situations, during which something different happens

sentences.english: She seems very sensible.
sentences.chinese: 她好像很明智。

sentences.english: sensible advice
sentences.chinese: 合理的建议

sentences.english: It’s sensible to keep a note of your passport number.
sentences.chinese: 把你的护照号码记下来是明智的。

sentences.english: Moving house seemed like the sensible thing to do .
sentences.chinese: 搬家似乎是明智的做法。

detailed_translations.english: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment

sentences.english: Her objection was that he was too young.
sentences.chinese: 她反对的理由是他太小。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 异议； 反对的理由
detailed_translations.english: a reason that you have for opposing or disapproving of something, or something you say that expresses this

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: observation
trans: 观测； 遵守； 观察报告

sentences.english: Darwin’s observations on the habits of certain birds
sentences.chinese: 达尔文对某些鸟类习性的论述

sentences.english: Paz makes some observations about the role of the critic.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯论述了评论家的作用。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written remark about something you have noticed

sentences.english: ...allegations of police entrapment.
sentences.chinese: ...关于警方实施诱捕的指控。

detailed_translations.english: the practice of trapping someone by tricking them, especially to show that they are guilty of a crime

sentences.english: ...a white enamel saucepan.
sentences.chinese: …一个白色搪瓷煮锅。

detailed_translations.english: a hard shiny substance that is put onto metal, clay etc for decoration or protection

name: rugged
trans: 高低不平的， 崎岖的

sentences.english: a rugged coastline
sentences.chinese: 崎岖不平的海岸线

sentences.english: the rugged beauty of the Highlands
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰高地崎岖起伏的美景

detailed_translations.chinese: 崎岖的；坚固的；高低不平的；粗糙的
detailed_translations.english: land that is rugged is rough and uneven

name: aggression
trans: 侵略， 侵犯； 敌对行为

sentences.english: an unprovoked act of aggression
sentences.chinese: 无端的侵犯

detailed_translations.english: the act of attacking a country, especially when that country has not attacked first

sentences.english: She strongly suspected he was lying to her.
sentences.chinese: 她非常怀疑他在对她撒谎。

sentences.english: She’s not going to be very happy about this, I suspect .
sentences.chinese: 我想对于此事她不会太高兴。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, especially something bad
someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime

sentences.english: All those lives maintained in the rarefied air of the absurd could not persevere without some profound and constant thought to infuse its strength into them.
sentences.chinese: 没有某种深邃的思想一成不变地为之输入力量，所有这些在荒谬的稀薄空气中维持的生命都无法继续。

detailed_translations.english: to fill something or someone with a particular feeling or quality

name: fraction
trans: 片段； 小部分； 分数

sentences.english: I got these shoes at a fraction of the original price.
sentences.chinese: 我以原价的一个零头买到了这双鞋子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small amount of something

sentences.english: The water in the tank is constantly filtered.
sentences.chinese: 鱼缸里的水在不停地被过滤。

sentences.english: The ozone layer filters harmful UV rays from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 臭氧层过滤掉有害的太阳紫外线。

sentences.english: coffee filter papers
sentences.chinese: 咖啡滤纸

sentences.english: filter cigarettes (= with a filter at the end )
sentences.chinese: 过滤嘴香烟

detailed_translations.english: to remove unwanted substances from water, air etc by passing it through a special substance or piece of equipment
something that you pass water, air etc through in order to remove unwanted substances and make it clean or suitable to use

name: monopolistic
trans: 垄断的； 独占性的； 专利的

sentences.english: The company wants to maintain its monopolistic position.
sentences.chinese: 公司想继续维持它的垄断地位。

detailed_translations.chinese: 垄断的；独占性的；专利的
detailed_translations.english: controlling or trying to control an industry or business activity completely

sentences.english: The things people will do for charity never cease to amaze me (= I am always surprised by them ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们的慈善义举总是让我感到惊讶。

sentences.english: The rain ceased and the sky cleared.
sentences.chinese: 雨过天晴。

sentences.english: without cease
sentences.chinese: 不停地，持续地

detailed_translations.english: to stop doing something or stop happening
(it is a noun only in the phrase `without cease') end

sentences.english: Only 39 percent of patients were seen within four weeks of referral.
sentences.chinese: 被介绍转诊的病人中，只有39%的人在四个星期内得到了诊治。

detailed_translations.chinese: n参照；提及；被推举的人；转诊病人
显然地；可感觉得出地；看得出地

sentences.english: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement.
sentences.chinese: 该测试将评估能力而不是学业成绩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对估价； 评价， 评论
detailed_translations.english: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

name: prescription
trans: 药方； 指示； 惯例

sentences.english: The new drug will not require a physician's prescription.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药不需要医生的处方。

sentences.english: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist

sentences.english: Detectives are still trying to unravel the mystery surrounding his death.
sentences.chinese: 侦探们仍在试图解开他的死亡之谜。

detailed_translations.english: to understand or explain something that is mysterious or complicated

sentences.english: The match attracted over 40,000 spectators.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛吸引了四万多名观众。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is watching an event or game

sentences.english: These berries are edible, but those are poisonous.
sentences.chinese: 这些浆果可以吃，但那些有毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可以吃的， 可食用的
detailed_translations.english: something that is edible can be eaten

sentences.english: the value of a company’s assets
sentences.chinese: 公司的资产价值

detailed_translations.chinese: 资产， 财产； 有价值的特性或技能， 优点
detailed_translations.english: the things that a company owns, that can be sold to pay debts

sentences.english: This will take a minimum of one hour.
sentences.chinese: 这最少要用一个小时。

sentences.english: The minimum number of students we need to run the course is fifteen.
sentences.chinese: 我们开这门课程最少要有15个学生。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest amount of something or number of things that is possible or necessary
the minimum number, degree, or amount of something is the smallest or least that is possible, allowed, or needed

sentences.english: Food was often scarce in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 冬季常常粮食短缺。

sentences.english: There was fierce competition for the scarce resources .
sentences.chinese: 对这些紧缺资源的争夺非常激烈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的
detailed_translations.english: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

sentences.english: The brain itself does not fossilise, but the inside of the cranium retains an impression of its contours.
sentences.chinese: 脑部分本身是不会变成化石的，但在头盖骨内部却还保留着脑的轮廓。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your head that is made of bone and covers your brain

sentences.english: The project seems to obsess him.
sentences.chinese: 这项工程似乎令他着迷。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone obsesses you, you think or worry about them all the time and you cannot think about anything else – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: Before applying makeup, blot the face with a tissue to remove any excess oils.
sentences.chinese: 化妆之前，用纸巾吸干脸上所有过多的油。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吸墨水；弄上墨渍或污渍
detailed_translations.english: to make a wet surface become dry by pressing soft paper or cloth on it
a mark or dirty spot on something, especially made by ink

name: categorical
trans: 无条件的， 绝对的； 分类的

detailed_translations.chinese: 绝对的（名词categoricalness，副词categorically，异体字categoric）；直截了当的；无条件的；属于某一范畴的
detailed_translations.english: a categorical statement is a clear statement that something is definitely true or false

name: filibuster
trans: 阻挠议案通过； 妨碍议事

sentences.english: Opponents of the bill tried to filibuster its final stages.
sentences.chinese: 反对者发表长篇大论，试图阻挠议案的最终通过。

detailed_translations.chinese: 海盗；暴兵，掠夺兵；阻挠议事的议员；阻挠议事的行动

sentences.english: a sign of incipient madness
sentences.chinese: 精神失常的早期征兆

detailed_translations.chinese: 初期的；初始的；起初的；发端的
detailed_translations.english: starting to happen or exist

name: reveal
trans: 启示； 揭露 publicly or generally known)； 显示(to open up to view)

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

name: theoretical
trans: 不切实际的； 理论的

sentences.english: These findings have both theoretical and practical applications.
sentences.chinese: 这些发现具有理论和实际的应用。

sentences.english: In this process, an interaction of theoretical study with practical work . should be strengthened.
sentences.chinese: 在这个过程中，要加强理论的探讨和工作推进的互动作用。

sentences.english: Researchers have tossed around theoretical calculations of using just aluminum and water for rocket propellant in the past.
sentences.chinese: 研究者在过去辗转不安的进行理论计算，仅仅只用铝和水作为火箭燃料。

sentences.english: All the battleships can refresh in this harbor.
sentences.chinese: 所有战舰都能在这个港口装上补充供应品。

sentences.english: It is the harbor of Athens.
sentences.chinese: 它是雅典的港口城。

sentences.english: She stands on a small island in New York harbor, near the great city.
sentences.chinese: 她竖立在纽约海港的一座小岛，并紧挨着纽约这座大城市。

name: hospitable
trans: 热情友好的； 宜人的

sentences.english: The local people were very kind and hospitable.
sentences.chinese: 当地人非常友好热情。

detailed_translations.english: friendly, welcoming, and generous to visitors

detailed_translations.chinese: 词尾变化；变格；倾斜；衰退
detailed_translations.english: the set of various forms that a noun,  pronoun  , or adjective can have according to whether it is the  subject  ,  object  etc of a sentence in a language such as Latin or German

sentences.english: a cork bulletin board
sentences.chinese: 软木公告板

detailed_translations.english: the  bark (= outer part )  of a tree from southern Europe and North Africa, used to make things
to close a bottle by blocking the hole at the top tightly with a long round piece of cork or plastic

sentences.english: Suddenly, there was a tremendous bang, and the whole station shook.
sentences.chinese: 突然一声巨响，整个车站都晃动了。

sentences.english: She was making a tremendous effort to appear calm.
sentences.chinese: 她竭力表现出平静的样子。

sentences.english: She praised her husband for the tremendous support he had given her.
sentences.chinese: 她称赞丈夫给了她巨大支持。

sentences.english: Sales have been tremendous so far this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年到目前为止，销售额十分惊人。

sentences.english: This plan could save us a tremendous amount of money.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划能给我们节省一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: very big, fast, powerful etc

sentences.english: Some identifiers are hybrid, or combinations of symbol and logotype.
sentences.chinese: 有些标识是杂交，或符号和标识的组合。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of type with several uncombined characters cast on it

sentences.english: The costs were escalating alarmingly.
sentences.chinese: 成本在以惊人的速度增长。

sentences.english: policies that escalate their own costs
sentences.chinese: 促使其自身成本增加的政策

sentences.english: escalating crime
sentences.chinese: 愈演愈烈的犯罪活动

detailed_translations.english: to become higher or increase, or to make something do this

name: condense
trans: 使冷凝， 浓缩； 缩短

sentences.english: This whole chapter could be condensed into a few paragraphs.
sentences.chinese: 这一整章可以压缩成几个段落。

detailed_translations.english: to make something that is spoken or written shorter, by not giving as much detail or using fewer words to give the same information

name: barrier
trans: 栅栏；  障碍， 壁垒

sentences.english: He advocated the removal of trade barriers.
sentences.chinese: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。

sentences.english: Crowds burst through the barriers and ran onto the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 人群冲破围栏跑进球场。

sentences.english: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 群山构成了两国之间的天然屏障。

detailed_translations.english: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

sentences.english: They hope to revitalize the neighborhood by providing better housing.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望通过提供更好的住房条件使这个社区恢复活力。

sentences.english: a revitalizing massage
sentences.chinese: 让人恢复精神的按摩

detailed_translations.english: to put new strength or power into something

sentences.english: Katzen offered little evidence to substantiate his claims .
sentences.chinese: 卡曾拿不出什么证据来证明他的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to prove the truth of something that someone has said, claimed etc

sentences.english: A herd of antelopes, asses, buffalos, caribou, deer, elephants, elk, giraffes, harts, horses, ibex, moose, seals, sheep, walruses, whales, zebras.
sentences.chinese: 一群羚羊，驴，野牛，驯鹿，鹿，大象，麋鹿，长颈鹿，雄鹿，马，野山羊，驼鹿，海豹，山羊，海象，鲸鱼，斑马。

sentences.english: In the Canadian Yukon, scientists are using genetic techniques to identify caribou and to study ancient caribou that roamed the same ice patches 6,000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 在加拿大的育空地区，科学家们正在利用基因技术来鉴别北美驯鹿，并探究古时驯鹿的相关信息，6000年前它们曾在这块流冰区漫步。

detailed_translations.english: a North American  reindeer

sentences.english: They corralled the cattle before loading them onto the truck.
sentences.chinese: 他们在把牛装上车以前，先把牛赶入了畜栏。

detailed_translations.english: a fairly small enclosed area where cattle, horses etc can be kept temporarily, especially in North America

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…关进畜栏；捕捉；把…布成车阵
detailed_translations.english: to make animals move into a corral

sentences.english: British newspapers are highly partisan .
sentences.chinese: 英国报纸的立场壁垒分明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 党派的；效忠的；偏袒的；盲目推崇的
detailed_translations.english: strongly supporting a particular political party, plan or leader, usually without considering the other choices carefully
a member of an armed group that fights against an enemy that has taken control of its country

sentences.english: This made no sense. All the eggs are fertilized already.
sentences.chinese: 这可说不通，因为所有的卵都已经受精了。

sentences.english: But why should a molecule found on fertilized eggs release such fury?
sentences.chinese: 但是为什么受精卵上的分子可以造成如此的愤怒。

sentences.english: After allowing the virus to infect the eggs, the team fertilized them with normal cat sperm and injected them into the fallopian tubes of 22 female cats.
sentences.chinese: 病毒感染卵细胞之后，小组用正常猫精子使卵细胞受精，并且把这些受精卵注入22只雌性猫的输卵管中。

sentences.english: I hate to be the bearer of bad news.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌当坏消息的捎信人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 持票人；[建] 承木；[机] 托架；送信人；搬运工人
detailed_translations.english: The bearer of something such as a message is the person who brings it to you

sentences.english: ...the birthplace of Krishna, another god of the Hindu pantheon.
sentences.chinese: ...另一位印度教诸神克利世那的出生地。

detailed_translations.english: a group of famous and important people

name: indistinct
trans: 模糊的， 朦胧的； 难以清楚辨认的

sentences.english: She muttered something indistinct.
sentences.chinese: 她含含糊糊地嘟哝了句什么。

sentences.english: My memory of what happened next is indistinct.
sentences.chinese: 接下来发生了什么我都不记得了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 模糊的，不清楚的；朦胧的；难以清楚辨认的
detailed_translations.english: an indistinct sound, image, or memory cannot be seen, heard, or remembered clearly

sentences.english: The company has doubled in value during his tenure.
sentences.chinese: 在他的任期内，公司的市值翻了一番。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time when someone has an important job

sentences.english: Look for a car hire agreement that offers unlimited mileage.
sentences.chinese: 找一份能提供不限里程数的租车协议。

detailed_translations.english: the number of miles someone travels in a vehicle in a particular period of time

sentences.english: The police say they suspect the attack was carried out by animal rights activists.
sentences.chinese: 警方说他们怀疑这次袭击是由保护动物权利的激进分子实施的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 积极分子；激进主义分子
detailed_translations.english: someone who works hard doing practical things to achieve social or political change

sentences.english: She felt a tap on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得有人轻轻拍了拍她的肩膀。

sentences.english: I went up and tapped on the window.
sentences.chinese: 我走上去轻轻敲敲窗户。

detailed_translations.english: an act of hitting something lightly, especially to get someone’s attention
to hit your fingers lightly on something, for example to get someone’s attention

sentences.english: Each individual leaf on the tree is different.
sentences.chinese: 树上每片叶子都不相同。

sentences.english: the needs of the individual customer
sentences.chinese: 每位顾客的需求

detailed_translations.english: considered separately from other people or things in the same group
a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

sentences.english: Losing weight is an indirect result of smoking cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟间接导致体重减轻。

sentences.english: The indirect effects of climate change may be profound.
sentences.chinese: 气候变化造成的间接影响可能是深远的。

sentences.english: George’s comments were an indirect way of blaming me.
sentences.chinese: 乔治的评论转弯抹角地指责了我。

detailed_translations.english: not directly caused by something

sentences.english: I believe in the maxim "if it ain't broke, don't fix it."
sentences.chinese: 我相信这句格言：“如果它没坏，不要去修理它。”

detailed_translations.english: a well-known phrase or saying, especially one that gives a rule for sensible behaviour

sentences.english: He could be a bit of a nuisance when he was drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他喝醉时会是一个有点令人讨厌的人。

detailed_translations.english: a person, thing, or situation that annoys you or causes problems

sentences.english: He braced himself for the icy plunge into the black water.
sentences.chinese: 他准备跳入冰冷的黑水。

detailed_translations.english: to mentally or physically prepare yourself or someone else for something unpleasant that is going to happen

detailed_translations.chinese: 使防备，使受锻炼；支住，撑牢，使绷紧
detailed_translations.english: to make something stronger by supporting it
something that is used to strengthen or support something, or to make it stiff

name: prolonged
trans: 延长的； 拖延的； 持续很久的

sentences.english: prolonged exposure to the sun
sentences.chinese: 长时间暴露在阳光下

sentences.english: a prolonged period of time
sentences.chinese: 很长一段时间

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a long time

sentences.english: The king wanted to enhance his prestige through war.
sentences.chinese: 国王想通过战争来提高自己的威信。

sentences.english: This little-known British firm has now gained considerable prestige .
sentences.chinese: 这家名不见经传的英国公司如今已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: the personal prestige attached to owning a large property
sentences.chinese: 拥有大房子所带来的体面

detailed_translations.english: the respect and admiration that someone or something gets because of their success or important position in society

sentences.english: ...the women's suffrage movement.
sentences.chinese: ...女性选举权运动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选举权；投票；参政权；代祷；赞成票
detailed_translations.english: the right to vote in national elections

name: activism
trans: 行动主义； 激进主义

sentences.english: The constant buzz of shared activity and knowledge gives rise to constant innovation and activism.
sentences.chinese: 共同活动和知识的不断传播带来了不断的创新和激进主义。

sentences.english: The baby boomers, who entered adulthood promising a lifetime of activism, have been a politically undistinguished generation.
sentences.chinese: 出生于生育高峰的人，在成年后承诺行动主义，只是一代政治上平庸的一代。

sentences.english: Japanese bosses gripe about activism, yet privately concede that the pressure is spurring many firms to increase returns to shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 日本的老板抱怨激进主义，然而，私下却承认这种压力刺激了很多公司给股东增加了投资回报。

detailed_translations.chinese: 行动主义； 激进主义
detailed_translations.english: Activism is the process of campaigning in public or working for an organization in order to bring about political or social change

sentences.english: the former Soviet bloc
sentences.chinese: 前苏联阵营

detailed_translations.english: a large group of people or countries with the same political aims, working together

name: cord
trans: 绳， 索； 【解】 索状组织

sentences.english: The robe was held at the waist by a cord.
sentences.chinese: 在袍子腰处束了根细绳。

sentences.english: He pulled explosives and some tangled cord from his bag.
sentences.chinese: 他从他的包里掏出炸药和一些乱糟糟的绳子。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of thick string or thin rope

name: putty
trans: 油灰； 易被摆布的人

sentences.english: Punch in the nails and then fill the holes flush with putty.
sentences.chinese: 把钉子钉进去，然后再用油灰把洞抹平。

detailed_translations.english: a soft whitish substance that becomes hard when it dries and that is used to fix glass into window frames

sentences.english: the council for civil liberties
sentences.chinese: 公民自由委员会

sentences.english: the UN Security Council
sentences.chinese: 联合国安全理事会

detailed_translations.english: a group of people that are chosen to make rules, laws, or decisions, or to give advice

sentences.english: Barker’s testimony is crucial to the prosecution’s case.
sentences.chinese: 巴克的证词对控方的指控起到了关键作用。

sentences.english: In his testimony, he denied that the company had ignored safety procedures.
sentences.chinese: 他在证词中否认公司忽视了安全程序。

detailed_translations.english: a formal statement saying that something is true, especially one a  witness  makes in a court of law

sentences.english: There were no injuries or damage, but the attack raised the prospect of further Israeli retaliation.
sentences.chinese: 这次袭击没有造成伤亡或者破坏，但是却使以色列有可能进一步报复。

sentences.english: The residents and witnesses all spoke on condition of anonymity for fear of retaliation.
sentences.chinese: 传播短信的居民和目击者出于害怕报复的考虑均采用匿名。

detailed_translations.english: action against someone who has done something bad to you

sentences.english: an anatomical examination
sentences.chinese: 解剖检查

detailed_translations.chinese: 解剖的；解剖学的；结构上的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the structure of human or animal bodies

sentences.english: Parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.
sentences.chinese: 停车限制将会严格执行。

sentences.english: It is unlikely that a record company would enforce its views on an established artist.
sentences.chinese: 唱片公司未必能强迫一位已出名的艺人接受他们的意见。

detailed_translations.english: to make people obey a rule or law

sentences.english: Suppose the width of a rectangle is x metres.
sentences.chinese: 设长方形的宽是 x 米。

detailed_translations.english: a shape that has four straight sides, two of which are usually longer than the other two, and four 90˚ angles at the corners

sentences.english: The length refers to the length of the arm; because the throwing motion is rotational from the shoulder out, the atlatl simply lengthens the arm to increase the throwing speed and force.
sentences.chinese: 长度是指胳膊长度，因为抛扔运动是以肩膀关节为中心的旋转运动，这样一来，飞镖投掷器只不过是手臂的延长，因此，增加了投掷的速度和力量。

sentences.english: There are several departures for New York every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天有好几个班次去纽约。

detailed_translations.english: an act of leaving a place, especially at the start of a journey

name: fragile
trans: 脆的， 易碎的； 脆弱的

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

detailed_translations.chinese: 精巧装置的发明；小巧机械的发明

sentences.english: You said in your address that "developing excellence is a slow, painstaking process".
sentences.chinese: 你在你的致词中说“发展卓越性是一个缓慢艰苦的过程”。

sentences.english: In order to transform their environment, he drew up the project with painstaking accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 为了改造环境， 他苦心孤诣地制订了这个计划。

sentences.english: What does that mean in concrete terms ?
sentences.chinese: 具体来说那到底是什么意思？

sentences.english: the lack of any concrete evidence
sentences.chinese: 缺少具体证据的

sentences.english: a dialogue about concrete issues and problems
sentences.chinese: 有关具体事情和问题的对话

detailed_translations.english: definite and specific

sentences.english: Dave made a note of her address and phone number.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫记下了她的地址和电话号码。

sentences.english: I was going to write Kathy a note, but I decided to call her instead.
sentences.chinese: 我原来准备给凯茜写个便条，但又决定还是打电话给她。

sentences.english: The notes are at the back of the book.
sentences.chinese: 注解在书末。

detailed_translations.english: something that you write down to remind you of something

name: ancestry
trans: 祖先； 世系， 血统

sentences.english: Most people of European or African ancestry have the "wet" kind: thick and sticky.
sentences.chinese: 大多数欧洲或者非洲血统的人耳垢是湿的，厚的，有粘性的。

sentences.english: Martin has shown that, of the eukaryotic genes whose ancestry can be traced, 75 per cent or more came from bacteria rather than the host cell.
sentences.chinese: 马丁揭示，在哪些可以追溯到祖先的线粒体基因上，有75%或更多的成分来自当时外来的细菌而非宿主细胞。

sentences.english: You can only explain this by evolutionary common ancestry.
sentences.chinese: 你只能通过存在“进化上的共同祖先”来解释。

detailed_translations.english: the members of your family who lived a long time ago

sentences.english: No littering. Penalty $500.
sentences.chinese: 禁止乱扔垃圾。 违者罚款500美元。

sentences.english: Withdrawing the money early will result in a 10% penalty.
sentences.chinese: 提前支取这笔钱将被处以10%的罚金。

sentences.english: If he is convicted, he could receive the death penalty (= be killed as a punishment ) .
sentences.chinese: 一旦定罪，他可能会被判处死刑。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement

sentences.english: the exiled former president
sentences.chinese: 流亡国外的前总统

sentences.english: political exiles
sentences.chinese: 政治流亡者

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to leave their country, especially for political reasons
a person who is forced to live away from his or her own country

sentences.english: The outline of the ship became more distinct.
sentences.chinese: 船的轮廓变得更加清晰了。

detailed_translations.english: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

name: scale
trans: 鳞片； 规模； 等级

sentences.english: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。

sentences.english: I was shocked by the sheer scale (= very big scale ) of the destruction.
sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞
detailed_translations.english: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening
to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

sentences.english: Do notlet animals graze until you are notified that forage in your area is safe.
sentences.chinese: 得到你所在区域的饲料安全的通知前，不要让动物吃青草。

detailed_translations.english: food supplies for horses and cattle
to go around searching for food or other supplies

sentences.english: Lefkas has an abundance of lush green vegetation.
sentences.chinese: 莱夫卡斯有葱郁茂盛的植被。

detailed_translations.chinese: 植被；植物，草木；呆板单调的生活
detailed_translations.english: plants in general

sentences.english: nomadic herdsmen
sentences.chinese: 游牧民

detailed_translations.english: nomadic people are nomads

sentences.english: You’re hedging again - have you got the money or haven’t you?
sentences.chinese: 你又在闪烁其词了，你究竟有没有钱？

sentences.english: ‘That depends on my partner,’ she hedged.
sentences.chinese: “那取决于我的合伙人。”她避重就轻地答道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 避免直接回答；   套头交易； 以套期保值避免损失
detailed_translations.english: to avoid giving a direct answer to a question

detailed_translations.chinese: 保值措施；套期保值；树篱；防备；障碍物；套头，两面下注以避免损失
detailed_translations.english: a row of small bushes or trees growing close together, usually dividing one field or garden from another

name: restructure
trans: 调整， 重建； 更改结构

sentences.english: proposals to radically restructure Britain’s electronics industry
sentences.chinese: 彻底整顿英国电子行业的提议

detailed_translations.english: to change the way in which something such as a government, business, or system is organized

sentences.english: With the recent inclusions, there will be 28 delegates in all.
sentences.chinese: 连同新近加入的成员，总共将有28位代表。

detailed_translations.english: the act of including someone or something in a larger group or set, or the fact of being included in one

name: contributor
trans: 贡献者， 捐助者； 投稿者

sentences.english: campaign contributors
sentences.chinese: 竞选捐助人

sentences.english: the salient points of the report
sentences.chinese: 这份报告的要点

detailed_translations.english: the salient points or features of something are the most important or most noticeable parts of it

sentences.english: ...a book that purports to tell the whole truth.
sentences.chinese: …一本声称讲出全部真相的书。

detailed_translations.english: to claim to be or do something, even if this is not true
the general meaning of what someone says

name: eligible
trans: 合格的， 符合条件的

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

name: paternalism
trans: 家长式统治； 家长主义

sentences.english: ...the company's reputation for paternalism.
sentences.chinese: ...该公司家长作风的名声。

detailed_translations.english: when people in charge of an organization or society protect the members and give them what they need but do not allow them any freedom or responsibility

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier dislocated great stones.
sentences.chinese: 冰川使许多大石块移位了。

sentences.english: A river or glacier debouches on the plains.
sentences.chinese: 一条河流或冰川流向平原。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of ice which moves slowly down a mountain valley

name: shimmer
trans: 使闪烁， 发闪烁的微光

sentences.english: ...a shimmer of starlight.
sentences.chinese: …星光的闪烁。

detailed_translations.english: Shimmer is also a noun
to shine with a soft light that looks as if it shakes slightly

sentences.english: Chobe is also renowned for its large herds of elephant and buffalo.
sentences.chinese: 乔贝还以其大群的大象和水牛而闻名。

sentences.english: It was Tom’s duty to herd the cows.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的职责是放牛。

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals of one kind that live and feed together
to make animals move together in a group

sentences.english: ‘That’s not true,’ she protested in a shrill voice.
sentences.chinese: “不是这样的。”她尖声抗议道。

sentences.english: a shrill whistle
sentences.chinese: 一声刺耳的哨子声

sentences.english: Fran uttered a shrill scream.
sentences.chinese: 弗兰发出一声尖叫。

detailed_translations.english: a shrill sound is very high and unpleasant
to produce a very high and unpleasant sound
to produce a very high and unpleasant sound

sentences.english: Shute's prose is stark and chillingly unsentimental.
sentences.chinese: 舒特的散文刻板而冷峻。

detailed_translations.english: language in its usual form, as opposed to poetry

name: unconscious
trans: 不省人事的； 未发觉的， 未意识到的

sentences.english: She was found alive but unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 她被找到时还活着，但已不省人事。

detailed_translations.english: unable to see, move, feel etc in the normal way because you are not conscious

sentences.english: Each card has not only a date but the latitude and longitude, salinity measures, temperatures and depth of each data point.
sentences.chinese: 每个卡片不仅记有日期，还有每个数据点的纬度和经度，盐度，温度和深度的测量。

sentences.english: Those ratios provide clues about the temperature and salinity of the water in which the corals were immersed, Watanabe says.
sentences.chinese: 渡边刚表示，这些同位素比例为珊瑚生长环境的海水温度及盐度情况提供了线索。

sentences.english: Other factors influence phytoplankton growth rates, including water temperature and salinity, water depth, wind, and what kinds of predators are grazing on them.
sentences.chinese: 还有其他的因素影响着浮游植物的生长率，包括水温、盐度、水深、风，以及猎食它们的天敌的种类。

sentences.english: Oats provide good, nutritious food for horses.
sentences.chinese: 燕麦为马提供营养丰富的好饲料。

detailed_translations.chinese: 燕麦；燕麦片（oat的复数）；燕麦粥
detailed_translations.english: the grain from which flour or oatmeal is made and that is used in cooking, or in food for animals

name: orientation
trans: 方向， 取向， 目标

sentences.english: The company needs to develop a stronger orientation towards marketing its products.
sentences.chinese: 公司需要针对其产品的营销设定一个更为明确的目标。

sentences.english: How can we get students to adopt a serious orientation to learning?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样才能让学生对学习采取认真的态度呢？

detailed_translations.english: the type of activity or subject that a person or organization seems most interested in and gives most attention to

name: racism
trans: 种族歧视； 种族主义

sentences.english: The government has promised to continue the fight against racism.
sentences.chinese: 政府已承诺继续打击种族歧视。

sentences.english: the problem of racism in schools
sentences.chinese: 学校里的种族歧视问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 种族主义，种族歧视；人种偏见
detailed_translations.english: unfair treatment of people, or violence against them, because they belong to a different race from your own

sentences.english: She motioned for the locked front doors to be opened.
sentences.chinese: 她打手势示意把锁着的前门打开。

sentences.english: He stood aside and motioned Don to the door.
sentences.chinese: 他站在一边，示意唐到门口。

detailed_translations.english: If you motion to someone, you move your hand or head as a way of telling them to do something or telling them where to go

detailed_translations.chinese: 运动；手势，眼色，动作；提议
detailed_translations.english: the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

name: idle
trans: 闲置的； 无用的； 懒散的

sentences.english: I cannot afford to leave the land lying idle.
sentences.chinese: 我不能让土地闲置。

sentences.english: The whole team stood idle, waiting for the mechanic.
sentences.chinese: 整队人干站着等技工来。

sentences.english: The workers have been idle for the last six months.
sentences.chinese: 最近六个月工人们都很闲。

detailed_translations.english: not working or producing anything

sentences.english: They do, however, greatly affect the implementation of those patterns.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它们的确对那些模式的 实现影响很大。

sentences.english: If I now scroll down to the actual implementation, now does this work or not work?
sentences.chinese: 如果现在我向下滚动到实际的执行中，这个是可用的还是不可用的呢？

sentences.english: One file describes the interface to your service, while the other file describes your implementation of it.
sentences.chinese: 一个文件描述到您的服务的接口，而另一个文件描述这个接口的实现。

sentences.english: French cuisine
sentences.chinese: 法式烹饪

sentences.english: vegetarian cuisine
sentences.chinese: 素食烹饪

detailed_translations.english: a particular style of cooking

sentences.english: I’m really sorry - it’s all my fault.
sentences.chinese: 我真的很抱歉——都是我的错。

sentences.english: I didn’t sleep well that night, but it was my own fault .
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我没有睡好，但这是我自己的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad that has happened is your fault, you should be blamed for it, because you made a mistake or failed to do something

sentences.english: an arbitrary decision
sentences.chinese: 武断的决定

sentences.english: the arbitrary arrests of political opponents
sentences.chinese: 对政敌的任意逮捕

detailed_translations.english: decided or arranged without any reason or plan, often unfairly

name: standardize
trans: 使标准化； 用标准检验

sentences.english: Attempts to standardize English spelling have never been successful.
sentences.chinese: 统一英语拼写的尝试从未成功过。

sentences.english: standardized tests
sentences.chinese: 标准化测试

detailed_translations.english: to make all the things of one particular type the same as each other

sentences.english: heavy showers of rain and hail
sentences.chinese: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

detailed_translations.english: frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice

detailed_translations.chinese: 致敬；招呼；向欢呼；猛发；使像下雹样落下（过去式hailed，过去分词hailed，现在分词hailing，第三人称单数hails）
detailed_translations.english: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

sentences.english: his intent gaze
sentences.chinese: 他专注的凝视

detailed_translations.chinese: 专心的， 专注的； 急切的
detailed_translations.english: giving careful attention to something so that you think about nothing else
what you intend to do

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

sentences.english: ...farming without any purchased chemical, fertilizer or pesticide.
sentences.chinese: …不使用任何购买的化学品、肥料或杀虫剂的耕作。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is put on the soil to make plants grow

sentences.english: Recent medical studies confirm the efficacy of a healthier lifestyle.
sentences.chinese: 近来的医学研究证实了更健康的生活方式的功效。

detailed_translations.english: the ability of something to produce the right result

sentences.english: ...the end of the monsoon.
sentences.chinese: …雨季的结束。

detailed_translations.chinese: 季风；（印度等地的）雨季；季候风
detailed_translations.english: the season, from about April to October, when it rains a lot in India and other southern Asian countries

name: beckon
trans: 召唤； 吸引， 引诱

sentences.english: I could see my husband beckoning me.
sentences.chinese: 我看到我丈夫在向我招手。

detailed_translations.english: to make a signal to someone with your hand, to show that you want them to come towards you or to follow you

sentences.english: glass fragments
sentences.chinese: 玻璃碎片

detailed_translations.chinese: 碎片；片断或不完整部分
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of something that has broken off or that comes from something larger
to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval

name: corresponding
trans: 相当的； 一致的； 通信的

sentences.english: The war and the corresponding fall in trade have had a devastating effect on the country.
sentences.chinese: 战争以及由此所导致的贸易量下降对这个国家产生了致命的影响。

sentences.english: Sales are up 10% on the corresponding period last year.
sentences.chinese: 销售比去年同期增加了10%。

detailed_translations.english: caused by or connected with something you have already mentioned

sentences.english: He was very skilled at pointing down the blocks of granite.
sentences.chinese: 他善于把花岗岩石凿平。

sentences.english: If you're working in steel or granite, redesigning or adding onto something is very expensive.
sentences.chinese: 如果你用钢或花岗岩来工作，重新设计或增加一些东西是很贵的。

sentences.english: Everything you see, from the cobblestones the characters walk on to the granite within the buildings, all those details help to bring you into that era.
sentences.chinese: 影片里你所见之处，从角色走过的鹅卵石路到大楼的花岗石，所有的细节都能帮助将你置身于那个年代。” 克罗尔解释道。

detailed_translations.english: a very hard grey rock, often used in building

sentences.english: The company divested itself of its oil interests.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司从石油生意中抽身。

detailed_translations.english: If you divest yourself of something that you own or are responsible for, you get rid of it or stop being responsible for it

sentences.english: Both sides have agreed to sign the treaty .
sentences.chinese: 双方都同意签署该条约。

sentences.english: The peace treaty ends nearly four years of violence.
sentences.chinese: 该和平条约结束了将近四年的暴力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 条约， 协议， 协定
detailed_translations.english: a formal written agreement between two or more countries or governments

name: responsive
trans: 有反应的； 反应迅速的， 敏感的

sentences.english: I tried to get him talking about his problems, but he wasn’t very responsive .
sentences.chinese: 我试图让他谈谈他的问题，但他不是很愿意讲。

detailed_translations.english: eager to communicate with people, and to react to them in a positive way

sentences.english: Farmers still sometimes unearth human bones here.
sentences.chinese: 农民们有时仍然能在这里挖到人骨。

sentences.english: In one shop, I unearthed a wonderful collection of 1920s toys.
sentences.chinese: 在一家商店，我发现了一套非常好玩的 20 世纪 20 年代的玩具。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发掘；揭露，发现；从洞中赶出
detailed_translations.english: to find something after searching for it, especially something that has been buried in the ground or lost for a long time

sentences.english: The kettle emitted a shrill whistle.
sentences.chinese: 水壶发出了刺耳的鸣笛声。

detailed_translations.english: to send out gas, heat, light, sound etc

sentences.english: people in the over-45 age category
sentences.chinese: 属45岁以上年龄组的人

sentences.english: Seats are available in eight of the ten price categories .
sentences.chinese: 座位共有10种票价，现有8种可售。

sentences.english: Williams’ style does not fit easily into the category of jazz.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯的风格不能轻易归入爵士乐的范畴。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people or things that are all of the same type

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

name: underwriter
trans: 保险公司， 保险业者； 担保人

sentences.english: If the market will not buy the shares, the underwriter buys them.
sentences.chinese: 如果市场不买这些股票，包销商就会买。

detailed_translations.chinese: 保险公司；保险业者；承诺支付者；担保人
detailed_translations.english: someone who makes insurance contracts

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…之资本估价过高；过分投资于
detailed_translations.english: to provide or issue capital for (an enterprise) in excess of profitable investment opportunities

sentences.english: A twig snapped under my feet.
sentences.chinese: 一根细枝在我脚下嚓一声断开了。

sentences.english: The wind snapped branches and power lines.
sentences.chinese: 大风刮断了树枝和输电线。

detailed_translations.chinese: 咔嚓折断， 啪地绷断； 猛咬； 猛然断裂 <；吧嗒一声；厉声说话， 怒声责骂
detailed_translations.english: to break with a sudden sharp noise, or to make something do this
a judgment or decision made quickly, without careful thought or discussion
to take a photograph
a sudden loud sound, especially made by something breaking or closing
